AbstractEnactable.java

00002 package ajc;
00003 
00004 import ajc.data.*;
00005 
00006 /*
00007  * Since constructors are never inherited, acj must generate a 
00008  * constructor for each Enactable initializing factory.
00009  */
00010 
00011 public abstract class AbstractEnactable implements Enactable {
00012     protected DataFactory factory;
00013 
00014     protected Data fail() throws Failed {
00015         Failed e = new Failed();
00016         //e.printStackTrace();
00017         throw e;
00018     }
00019     protected Data raise(Data data) throws Exceptional {
00020         Exceptional e = new Exceptional(data);
00021         //e.printStackTrace();
00022         throw e;
00023     }
00024 
00025     protected Data catchExceptional(Exception e) throws Failed {
00026         if (e instanceof Exceptional) 
00027             return ((Exceptional)e).getData();
00028         if (e instanceof Failed)
00029             throw (Failed)e;
00030         if (e instanceof ClassCastException)
00031             return factory.makeEmpty(); 
00032         e.printStackTrace();
00033         System.exit(1);
00034         return null;
00035     }
00036 
00037 }
